Class: CollectionResource

CollectionResource

new CollectionResource()

Encapsulates a collection resource, making it possible to paginate through the collection in an asynchronous manner.

Typically you do not need to manually construct a CollectionResource. Rather, you will obtain a resource collection from a getter method, such as Client.getApplications().

Source:
  • resource/CollectionResource.js, line 106

Methods

each(iterator, doneCallback)

Visit each resouce in the collection.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
iterator function

The function to call, for each resource in the collection. Will be called with (resource, next). The next() function must be called in order to advance to the next resource. If a truthy value is passed to next, such as next(err), the interation will stop and the doneCallback will be called with the value.
doneCallback function

The function to call when all items have been visited. If next(err) has been used, the err will be passed to this function.
Source:
  • resource/CollectionResource.js, line 168
Example
application.getAccounts({ email: 'mydomain.com' }, function(err, collection){
  collection.each(function iterator(account, next){
    console.log('Found account for ' + account.givenName + ' (' + account.email + ')' );
    next();
  }, function doneCallback(){
    console.log('All accounts have been visited').
  });
});
